Content_FullWidth.Title: "Part-time Matriculated" Status Discontinued
Content_FullWidth.BodyCopy:
In an effort to streamline and simplify admission and enrollment processes, BYU-Idaho has determined the "part-time matriculated" status for students will be discontinued. All students will now apply and enroll under "full-time matriculated" status. Students can then take part-time to full-time credit loads--ranging from .5 to 21 credits--as needed.

Under the new arrangement, students who take a part-time credit load will be eligible for more university services than those who were enrolled using the previous "part-time matriculated" student status. Application periods will remain the same. The "non-matriculated" status is not being discontinued. Members of the community and relatives of university employees can still take courses as non-matriculated, non-degree seeking students.
